item.title: What is the Book of Mormon? A 60-Second Overview
item.description: This animation gives a short but poignant view of The Book of Mormon and it's relevance to each of us.

item.title: The Holy Bible
item.description: The Holy Bible is a sacred book that contains the word of God. It foretells the coming of Jesus Christ and describes His life, mission, and sacred role as the Son of God and Savior of the world.

item.title: “That They Might Know Thee the Only True God”
item.description: “The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God” (Romans 8:16).

item.title: The Coming Forth of Biblia Sagrada, Almeida 2015
item.description: The First Presidency announces the Latter-day Saint edition of Biblia Sagrada, Almeida 2015; the translation’s history; and the blessings of regular scripture study.

item.title: First Presidency Announcement: Biblia Sagrada, Almeida 2015
item.description: The First Presidency announces the Latter-day Saint edition of Biblia Sagrada, Almeida 2015.

item.title: Inspiration for All People at All Times: The Holy Bible
item.description: The Holy Bible teaches us about our Savior, Jesus Christ. Search and feast, "for behold, the words of Christ shall tell you all things what ye should do." (2 Nephi 32:3)

item.title: History of the Translation of Biblia Sagrada
item.description: Joao Ferreira Annes de Almeida, the translator of the Holy Bible in Portuguese, is among stalwart disciples who have translated the word of God.

item.title: Feasting on the Word
item.description: Elder José A. Teixeira, of the Seventy, describes the impact the revision of the Holy Bible in Portuguese will have on his life and on the lives of Portuguese-speaking Church members.

item.title: In our Own Language
item.description: Elder Ulisses Soares, of the Presidency of the Seventy, testifies of the great impact the revision of the Holy Bible in Portuguese will have on Portuguese-speaking Church members.

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: Scriptures Legacy – Extended Broadcast Version
item.description: Ancient and modern prophets and disciples sacrificed much to preserve and provide the scriptures. These scriptures now help us measure correctness and truth, strengthen our faith, and light our path.

item.title: Scriptures Legacy
item.description: Ancient and modern prophets and disciples sacrificed much to preserve and provide the scriptures. These scriptures now help us measure correctness and truth, strengthen our faith, and light our path.

item.title: Reflecting God's Love—What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: A seasoned leader discusses the role of the scriptures in his personal life and callings over the years as he strives to reflect the love God has for his children.

item.title: Christlike Motherhood—What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: A sister discusses the role the scriptures play as she strives to be a better mother; teaching and raising each of her children as Christ would want her to teach them.

item.title: Continuous Conversion—What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: A young brother discusses the role of the scriptures in his and his mother’s conversion, in his own mission experience, and in his ongoing role as a young father and Church member.

item.title: What Scriptures Mean to Me
item.description: The scriptures can hold personal meaning for each individual.

item.title: Daily Bread: Pattern
item.description: Just as we need daily physical sustenance, the need for daily spiritual sustenance is just as strong. We can remember Jesus Christ every day as we pray, read the scriptures, and meditate.

item.description: (Alma 39:9) Elder Dallin H. Oaks counsels young men to do everything possible to avoid pornography. Young women are counseled to dress modestly.

item.title: Proper and Perfect Frame
item.description: (Alma 40:23) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the comfort in knowing that everyone will be resurrected; we can be strengthened by the knowledge that physical, mental, and emotional challenges in this life are temporary.

item.title: Wickedness Never Was Happiness
item.description: (Alma 41:10–11) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about how “wickedness never was happiness”.

item.title: The Demands of Justice
item.description: (Alma 42:22–25) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about the demands of justice.

item.title: Captain Moroni
item.description: (Alma 43–48) A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni’s faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example that all Saints should follow. Segment 1, Captain Moroni.

item.title: Firm in the Faith
item.description: (Alma 43–48) A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni’s faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example that all Saints should follow. Segment 2, Song: “Firm in the Faith”.

item.title: Fight for Families
item.description: (Alma 43:45–47) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fighting for the cause of the family.

item.title: Believers in the Book of Mormon
item.description: (Alma 46:13–15) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin teaches that Christians believe in the Savior and act in harmony with His teachings.

item.title: Don’t Leave the High Ground
item.description: (Alma 47:10–18) Elder Robert D. Hales warns us not to leave the high ground.

item.title: The Importance of Covenants
item.description: (Alma 53:10–21) Elder M. Russell Ballard talks about the difference between living by convenience and living by covenants. Living and keeping covenants brings spiritual power.

item.title: Stripling Warriors
item.description: (Alma 53:10–21) Elder M. Russell Ballard speaks about the stripling warriors and their valiant fight for liberty.

item.title: We Do Not Doubt Our Mothers Knew It
item.description: (Alma 56:31–48) Sister Julie B. Beck testifies of the need for responsible mothers who can teach their children to withstand the temptations of the world.

item.title: Choose Not to Be Offended
item.description: (Alma 61) Elder David A. Bednar talks about making the choice not to be offended.

item.title: Our Own Storehouse of Faith
item.description: (Alma 62:39–41) President James E. Faust talks about having our own storehouse of faith.

item.title: Nephi Prays for His People
item.description: The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 1, Nephi Prays for His People

item.title: Nephi Prophesies Death of Chief Judge
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 2, Nephi Prophesies Death of Chief Judge.

item.title: Nephi Proves His Innocence
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 3, Nephi Proves His Innocence.

item.title: Evil Secret Words Can Destroy Society
item.description: (Helaman 1-2) If we aren't careful, the temptations of secret combinations can weaken and ultimately destroy our communities.

item.title: Yielding Our Hearts to God
item.description: (Helaman 3:33–36) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about yielding our hearts to God.

item.title: The Spirit Does Not Dwell in Unholy Temples
item.description: (Helaman 4:23–26) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that the Spirit does not dwell in unholy temples.

item.title: Build on the Rock of Our Redeemer
item.description: (Helaman 5:12) President Henry B. Eyring tells us to build on the rock of our Redeemer.

item.title: Secret Combinations
item.description: (Helaman 6:37–40) Elder M. Russell Ballard warns of secret combinations and their effects on society.

item.title: All Prophets Testify of Jesus Christ and His Atonement
item.description: (Helaman 7:17–20) Elder Russell M. Nelson discusses the focus on Christ found throughout the teachings and testimonies given by Book of Mormon prophets. They testify and declare that Jesus is the Christ.

item.title: Hold upon Your Hearts
item.description: (Helaman 7:15–22) Elder M. Russell Ballard warns of ignoring the future by focusing only on the present.

item.title: The Sealing Power Binds and Looses on Earth and in Heaven
item.description: (Helaman 10:4–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what we must understand in preparing to receive temple ordinances.

item.title: Power in the Priesthood
item.description: (Helaman 11:4–17) Elder Bruce R. McConkie speaks of the incredible power of the priesthood.

item.title: The Cure for Forgetting God
item.description: (Helaman 12:1–6) President Henry B. Eyring tells us the cure for forgetting God.

item.title: The Lord Chastens His People to Stir Them Up in Remembrance of Him
item.description: (Helaman 12:3) Elder Glenn L. Pace talks about the spiritual devastation of disobedience to God’s commandments in the world. As in previous dispensations, the Lord allows “wake-up calls” to give his children opportunities to turn to Him.

item.title: Repentance Leads Us To Christ's Grace, 1
item.description: (Helaman 12:23-24) Elder Bednar shares how the grace of Jesus Christ blesses our lives.

item.title: Repentance Leads us to Christ's Grace, 2
item.description: (Helaman 12:23–24) Elder Gene R. Cook teaches how we can restore grace through the conditions of repentance. Grace is also obtained through keeping the commandments .

item.title: It Is Too Late
item.description: (Helaman 13:36–39) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how some people procrastinate the day of their salvation until it is too late. (“Now Is the Time to Prepare,” Ensign, May 2005, 16–18.)

item.title: Declare the Way to Safety
item.description: (Helaman 16:4–5) President Henry B. Eyring testifies of the Lord’s concern for our safety.

item.title: Alma 43 through Moroni (Segment 3)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: Come unto Christ
item.description: (Moroni 10:32) Elder Richard G. Scott gives examples about coming unto Christ.

item.title: Hope Leads
item.description: (Moroni 10:20–23) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about hope.

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, 2
item.description: (Moroni 10:4-5) Elder Bruce R. McConkie calls each of us to earnestly seek to know the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, Part 1
item.description: (Moroni 10:4–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares his experiences in gaining a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Test Moroni’s Promise
item.description: (Moroni 10:3–5) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about testing Moroni’s promise.

item.title: Children Are Alive in Christ
item.description: (Moroni 8:4–23) President Boyd K. Packer gave personal examples of how children are alive in Christ.

item.title: Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:45–48) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about the pure love of Christ and the connections open to us.

item.title: Charity: The Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:44-48) Charity is not an act, or state of being. It is something we become.

item.title: Light of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:12–19) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about the importance of the Light of Christ.

item.title: Retaining Converts
item.description: (Moroni 6:4–9) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin expresses the importance of reaching out to new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 2
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 1
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 2
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer teaches that without covenants, even good conduct cannot redeem nor exalt mankind.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 1
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares the credentials required to return to Heavenly Father and the challenge to keep covenants in this life.

item.title: I, Moroni
item.description: (Moroni 1:1–4) With his story of ferocious wolves, Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin instructs us to keep our testimonies strong to withstand Satan’s temptations.

item.title: I, Moroni, Will Not Deny the Christ
item.description: (Moroni 1) Sister Susan W. Tanner talks about what we can do to prevail amid loneliness. We must cling to the Lord’s promises.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:6) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that by acting upon impressions, you will receive confirming evidences of the Spirit, which strengthens your faith.

item.title: Great Faith Precedes Miracles
item.description: (Ether 12:5-22) President James E. Faust testifies that great faith is essential in overcoming challenges.

item.title: Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:4–6) President Boyd K. Packer gives a personal example about “the trial of your faith”. (“The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ—Plain and Precious Things, Ensign, May 2005, 6–9.)

item.title: Secret Combinations Destroy Civilizations
item.description: (Ether 8:20–26) Elder M. Russell Ballard speaks of the destructive power of secret combinations in today’s society.

item.title: A Steady, Reassuring Voice
item.description: (Ether 7:23–27) Elder Robert D. Hales teaches us to listen to the living prophets.

item.title: Testimony of the Witnesses
item.description: (Ether 5) Elder Dallin H. Oaks shares the significance of more than one witness to the Book of Mormon.

item.title: The Faith and Diligence of the Brother of Jared
item.description: (Ether 2:16; 3:5) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the faith and diligence of the brother of Jared.

item.title: Written for Us Today
item.description: (Mormon 8:34–35) President Ezra Taft Benson explains that the Book of Mormon was meant for our generation. We must, therefore, make it a center point of our study.

item.title: Prepared for Our Day
item.description: (Mormon 8:12–41) Elder L. Tom Perry explains that the Book of Mormon was prepared for our day.

item.title: Bible and Book of Mormon
item.description: (Mormon 7:8–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the Bible and the Book of Mormon as witnesses of Jesus Christ.

item.title: In the Hands of God
item.description: (Mormon 5:23) Elder W. Craig Zwick talks about the keys we need to feel comfort and to receive direction from the Lord.

item.title: We Can Choose Our Path
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:20–42) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that we cannot choose the consequences of our actions.

item.title: There Were No “Manner of –Ites”
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:16–17) Elder Richard G. Scott testifies that by aligning our traditions or customs with the Lord, we are promised happiness.

item.title: There Were "No Manner of -Ites"
item.description: (4th Nephi 1:16-17) President Faust talks about needing to find the value in one another and unifying the faith.

item.title: Truly Converted to the Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:1–19) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains what conversion truly means. We qualify for eternal life through conversion as we “do” and “become”.

item.title: Jesus and His Prophets
item.description: (4 Nephi 1) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin gives an example of the importance of following our leaders.

item.title: We Are the Covenant People of the Lord
item.description: (3 Nephi 28:30) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains some of the blessings of the Abrahamic covenant and that we are among the covenant people of the Lord.

item.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon Signaled the Beginning of the Gathering of Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 29:1–2) President Ezra Taft Benson teaches the value of the Book of Mormon as a tool in converting the world to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: What Manner of Men Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:27) President James E. Faust speaks about what kind of people we should be to be good disciples.

item.title: Gospel Is Good News
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:13–22) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the word gospel means good news and refers to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Tell Us the Name Whereby We Shall Call This Church
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:3–8) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about what it means to take upon us the name of Christ. Be faithful in fulfilling the duties and responsibilities in your sphere of responsibility.

item.title: Too Sacred to Discuss
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:13–21) President Boyd K. Packer speaks of the importance of not talking about sacred experiences.

item.title: Additional Scriptures
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:9–10) Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains that by giving heed to what the Lord has revealed, we prepare to receive greater revelation.

item.title: Our Obedience to Gospel Principles Helps us Prepare for the Second Coming of Jesus Christ
item.description: (3 Nephi 25:6) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about Elijah.

item.title: No Weapon that is Formed Against Thee Shall Prosper
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:17) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that those who oppose God’s work will not prevail. The righteous will press forward amid the opposition.

item.title: Jesus Wants Us to Succeed
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:6–10) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf explains why Jesus wants us to succeed.

item.title: The Book of Mormon Gathers Scattered Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 21:1–7) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the Book of Mormon gathers scattered Israel.

item.title: Who is the Seed of Abraham?
item.description: (3 Nephi 20:24–29) President James E. Faust talks about what it means to be the seed of Abraham.

item.title: We Can Have His Light
item.description: (3 Nephi 19:16–36) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about how we can have God’s light through the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Pray in Your Families
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:13–25) President James E. Faust talks about the importance of praying in your families.

item.title: Church Members should Extend Fellowship to All People, 1
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:22-32) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the urgency of retaining new converts

item.title: Partake of the Sacrament
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the sacrament prayers.

item.title: Jesus Blessed the Children “One by One”
item.description: (3 Nephi 17:14–25) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about how Jesus blessed the children and prayed for them.

item.title: God’s Laws Bless His Children
item.description: (3 Nephi 15:1–10) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that God’s laws govern and bless His children. (“We Believe All That God Has Revealed,” Ensign, Nov. 2003, 85–88.)

item.title: The Golden Rule
item.description: (3 Nephi 14:12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the golden rule encompasses the moral code.

item.title: God Forgive Us as We Forgive Others
item.description: (3 Nephi 13:11, 14–15) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches of extending and receiving forgiveness.

item.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:48) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the charge to become perfect like the Savior.

item.title: Going the Extra Mile
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:38–42) President James E. Faust teaches that some of the most rewarding times of our lives are from going the extra mile.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that being the salt of the earth is our covenant duty.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Carlos E. Asay tells how men might lose their “savor” as priesthood holders. He shares guidelines to help maintain spiritual strength in the priesthood. (“Salt of the Earth: Savor of Men and Saviors of Men,” Ensign, May 1980.)

item.title: Covenants and Ordinances
item.description: (3 Nephi 11:14–17) Elder David A. Bednar explains that we come unto Christ through covenants and ordinances.

item.title: Christ Brings Light Where There Is Darkness
item.description: (3 Nephi 10:9–13) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies of the comfort the gospel brings.

item.title: A Change in the Commandment to Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:20) Elder D. Todd Christofferson teaches that the sacrifice the Lord accepts is the gift of yourself—a broken heart and a contrite spirit.

item.title: The Devil Rejoices When We Sin
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:2, 13–15) Elder Robert D. Hales explains that the devil never has joy unless we sin; it is our sins that make him laugh.

item.title: True Conversion
item.description: (3 Nephi 7:21–26) Elder Richard G. Scott tells what conversion is and how it can lead to aligning our views to the Lord’s. He teaches how to become truly converted.

item.title: Pride Is Enmity
item.description: (3 Nephi 6:10–18) President Gordon B. Hinckley reads a message by President Ezra Taft Benson about the danger of pride.

item.title: A Living Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 2:1–3) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about a living sacrifice.

item.title: My Joy Is Full
item.description: Visual and music highlight this portrayal of the Savior's visit to the inhabitants of ancient America, providing a unique view of His caring, compassion, and love for His children.

item.title: Becoming Children of Christ
item.description: Two young women learn what it means to put off the natural man and become children of Christ.

item.title: Firm in the Faith of Christ
item.description: A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni's faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example all Saints should follow.

item.title: O Ye Fair Ones
item.description: As Mormon and his son Moroni behold the hundreds of thousands of Nephites slain in the last battle with the Lamanites, Mormon laments, "O ye fair ones, how could ye have departed from the ways of the Lord!"

item.title: The Mediator
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1977 general conference address. A young man who fails to pay a debt is saved from the grasp of justice through the mediation of a friend.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1976 general conference address. Just as well-camouflaged crocodiles prey on unwary victims, Satan preys on unwary youth by using tactics that camouflage the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people's wickedness.

item.title: Can You Imagine?
item.description: A young man's alter ego uses a courtroom setting to explore what it would be like to stand before God on Judgment Day.

item.title: Testimony of Truth
item.description: The Lord entrusts a testimony of truth with those who share it with others. Members should be willing to share the gospel whenever they feel moved by the spirit.

item.title: Pride Keeps Us from Choosing the Lord
item.description: (D&C 39:7-12) President Benson warns that pride keeps us from choosing the Lord.

item.title: Emma Smith Follows the Lord's Counsel
item.description: (D&C 25) Emma Smith follows the counsel of the Lord.

item.title: "An Elect Lady"
item.description: (D&C 25:2-3) Video portraying events in the life of Emma Smith.

item.title: Organization of the Church
item.description: (D&C 20) The Church of Jesus Christ is restored to the earth in 1830.

item.title: The Worth of Souls
item.description: (D&C 18:10-16) President Thomas S. Monson The Worth of Souls.

item.title: Endure to the End
item.description: (D&C 14:7) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches how to endure to the end.

item.title: Restoration of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: (D&C 13) Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery receive the Aaronic Priesthood by the hand of John the Baptist.

item.title: Our Work Is to Keep the Commandments
item.description: (D&C 11: 12-14) Elder David A. Bednar teaches how our work is to keep the commandments.

item.title: Thwarting Satan's Evil Designs
item.description: (D&C 10:20-27) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin teaches the importance of thwarting Satan's evil designs.

item.title: Proceed with Trust
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott teaches the importance of proceeding with trust (D&C 9:7-9).

item.title: Getting Answers to Prayers
item.description: (D&C 8-9) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches how to get answers to prayers.

item.title: Our Most Important Duty
item.description: (D&C 6:14-24) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland teaches about Our most important duty.

item.title: "This is the Spirit of Revelation"
item.description: (D&C 6,8-9) The early experiences of Oliver Cowdery serve as a case study to help students understand principles of personal revelation.

item.title: Missionaries to Match Our Message
item.description: (D&C 4) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains how we need missionaries to match Our message.

item.title: The Work of God
item.description: (D&C 3,10) Martin Harris tells a young man the story of the lost manuscript, emphasizing that the works, designs and purposes of God cannot be frustrated.

item.title: The True and Living Church
item.description: (D&C 1:30) President Henry B. Eyring teaches about the True and Living Church.

item.title: Seek the Lord
item.description: (D&C 1:14-16) A video showing the challenging choices that are placed before all people.

item.title: Joseph Smith and the Minister
item.description: (JS-H 1:21-26) Joseph Smith recounts his vision to a local minister.

item.title: The Great Apostasy
item.description: Wilford Woodruff's search for the true Church explains the Apostasy and need for the Restoration. It emphasizes four essential elements of the true Church that were lost because of the Great Apostasy.

item.title: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: Heavenly Father's plan of salvation is compared to a three-act play, showing that knowledge of the plan helps us in our everyday lives.

item.title: Overview of Church History
item.description: This video gives a brief introduction to the different time periods of Church history.

item.title: Testimony of Truth
item.description: The Lord entrusts a testimony of truth with those who share it with others. Members should be willing to share the gospel whenever they feel moved by the spirit.

item.title: If We Teach by the Spirit
item.description: By teaching and listening by the spirit, all are edified and strengthened, individually and collectively.

item.title: "An Eye Single to the Glory of God"
item.description: (D&C 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lord's to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Our Work Is to Go About Doing Good
item.description: (D&C 81:4-6) President Hinckley teaches that our work is to go about doing good.

item.title: The Church to Fill the Earth
item.description: (D&C 65) President Hinckley reviews the prophecy of how the Church will fill the earth.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: Those Tithed Not Burned at His Coming
item.description: (D&C 64:23-25) President Hinckley teaches that those tithed will not be burned at His coming.

item.title: "Upon My Holy Day"
item.description: (D&C 59:9-12) Elder Holland pleads with youth to keep the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: A Man without Eloquence
item.description: (D&C 50:17-22) The testimony of a humble teacher helps Brigham Young become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: Baptism of the Holy Ghost
item.description: (D&C 49:11-14) Elder Bednar teaches about the baptism of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: To "Act in All Holiness"
item.description: (D&C 43: 8-9,16) President Uchtdorf teaches how to "act in all holiness."

item.title: Healing the Sick
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about healing the sick (D&C 42:43-48).

item.title: Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Quote given by Elder Neil L. Andersen in the Saturday afternoon session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: We Must Forgive
item.description: The experience of Corrie ten Boom illustrates how we can feel the love of God when we forgive.

item.title: Latter-day Martyrs
item.description: James E. Faust relates the circumstances surrounding the martyrdom of Rafael Monroy and Vicente Morales.

item.title: The Savor of Men
item.description: When the Lord used the expression ‘savor of men,’ He was speaking of those who represent Him.

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Spirit and the Body
item.description: President Packer teaches about the spirit and the body (D&C 88:14-17).

item.title: Those Warned Must Warn Others
item.description: President Eyring explains those warned must warn others (D&C 88:81-82).

item.title: School of the Prophets
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about the School of the Prophets (D&C 88:117-137).

item.title: Wisdom against Conspiring Men
item.description: President Packer gives wisdom against conspiring men (D&C 89:1-4).

item.title: Great Treasures of Knowledge
item.description: President Packer teaches about great treasures of knowledge (D&C 89:18-21).

item.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
item.description: President Packer teaches about the keys of the kingdom (D&C 90:1-5).

item.title: Light and Truth, Part 2
item.description: This video examines God's attributes of light and truth as explained in section 88 of the Doctrine and Covenants (D&C 93:28,36-40).

item.title: We Must Keep Temples Sacred
item.description: President Hinckley admonishes that we must keep temples sacred (D&C 97:10-17).

item.title: Afflictions Can Be For Our Good
item.description: (D&C 98:1-3,11-22) Elder Oaks teaches that afflictions can be for our good.

item.title: Proclaim Peace
item.description: Elder Nelson counsels us to proclaim peace (D&C 98:16-18,23-48).

item.title: The Lord Tests His People
item.description: President Faust teaches that the Lord tests His people (D&C 101:1-19).

item.title: Gather in Stakes
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to gather in stakes (D&C 101:20-22,63-75).

item.title: God Raised Up Wise Men to Establish the Constitution
item.description: President Benson teaches that God raised up wise men to establish the U.S. Constitution (D&C 101:76-80,93-95).

item.title: The Church is Governed through Councils
item.description: Elder Ballard teaches the Church is governed through councils (D&C 102:1-11).

item.title: Disciplinary Councils
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about disciplinary Councils (D&C 102:9-33).

item.title: Pay Off Debts as Quickly as You Can
item.description: President Hinckley counsels us to pay off debts as quickly as possible (D&C 104:78-83).

item.description: (D&C 105) Several events from the march of Zion's Camp show how it fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.title: Succession in the Presidency

item.description: President Monson counsels to learn and do your duty (D&C 107:99-100).

item.title: Windows of Heaven Open to Obedient

item.title: Priesthood Keys Restored in Kirtland Temple
item.description: In a glorious vision the priesthood keys were restored in the Kirtland Temple (D&C 110:11-16).

item.title: Priesthood Keys Revealed
