item.description: (Luke 7:11-16) President Thomas S. Monson asks all to help those in need as the Savior did. ("Never Alone," Ensign, May 1991, 59-61.)

item.title: Stand Firm
item.description: (Luke 4:1-13) President James E. Faust urges all to have courage and resist Satan.

item.title: Church Membership
item.description: (Luke 3:7-14) President Joseph Fielding Smith confirms that all must endure to the end.

item.title: Increased In Wisdom
item.description: (Luke 2:52) President Thomas S. Monson teaches us that we need divine guidance.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: (Luke 2) This presentation depicts the account of Jesus's birth.

item.title: More Blessed to Give Than to Receive
item.description: President Monson tells a story from his youth that taught him it is better to give than receive.

item.title: Death Is Swallowed Up in Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies of the power of the Atonement and, if we will follow the Savior now, we will have less regrets tomorrow

item.title: God of Comfort
item.description: President Monson tells us that, even when the world is at its darkest, if we turn to the Lord; He will lift and guide us.

item.title: Youth and Family History
item.description: Elder Bednar counsels us to become more engaged in Family History work, so that we may become more involved in the Lord’s work by performing baptisms for the dead.

item.title: Foundation of Apostles and Prophets
item.description: Elder Holland tells us that Apostles and Prophets are meant to bless us all and form foundation stones of the true Church, and all of those are based upon the Redeemer.

item.title: Lively Hope of Resurrection
item.description: Elder Oaks expounds upon the vitality of the resurrection in the Father’s plan, and that because of it we may have hope for a better existence beyond out mortal lives.

item.title: Our bodies are our temples
item.description: Sister Tanner testifies that our bodies are temples, and should be treated as such.

item.title: Judging Others
item.description: Elder Ashton teaches that the Lord measures us by our hearts, not our worldly characteristics.

item.title: Shield of Faith Fashioned at Home
item.description: President Packer teaches that the Shield of Faith is forged in the family circle, and that all participate in its strength.

item.title: Abraham’s Seed
item.description: President Faust explains what it means to be Abraham’s seed, that as a part of that covenant we may also receive the promised blessings if we are faithful

item.title: Taking Pleasure in Infirmities
item.description: Elder Hales teaches that the Lord brings us close to Him by our trials, and that through these trials, we may be purified.

item.title: Pride
item.description: President Uchtdorf explains that pride is "a sin of comparison", and comes from a desire to be admired or envied.

item.title: Witnesses of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson teaches us that we have our eyewitnesses to the truth of Christ, and that the testimony of prophets gives us assurance that He lives.

item.title: Compassion for Others
item.description: Bishop Edgley tells us that we are blessed to be a part of a church in which we ‘endure together’.

item.title: An High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Holland testifies that, no matter how dark the world may seem, blessings will come for those that have embraced the Gospel of Jesus Christ

item.title: Hebrews 11:1
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar lays out the main elements and doctrines of faith.

item.title: The Future Is as Bright as Your Faith
item.description: President Monson testifies that, even during times when hope seems lost, so long as we have made the Gospel central to our lives and remain steadfast, we will be blessed beyond measure.

item.title: A Conscience Void of Offence
item.description: Elder Perry asks us if we feel ready for an inspection of our lives by the Lord, and gives examples of men who did feel prepared to meet judgment.

item.title: Testimony of the Resurrection
item.description: President Monson bears his testimony on the actuality of the Father, Christ, and the Atonement.

item.title: Requirements of Salvation
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches that in our cleansing is dependent upon our faith, and goes on to say that those who have been baptized will be finally saved at the end of their lives if they have continued in their covenants.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: Elder Cook advises members to become more active in sharing the Gospel with those around them. He tells us that if we do share with others, we will be blessed.

item.title: Selflessness
item.description: Elder Peterson describes the attributes of a truly selfless person and how they are willing to sacrifice for the benefit of others.

item.title: Feelings of Inadequacy
item.description: President Uchtdorf testifies that are things that God has given us to do, and that only we can do them.

item.title: Our Body Is Bought with a Price
item.description: Elder Christofferson tells us that is our duty to God to care for the bodies He has given us.

item.title: Account of Big Ed
item.description: Sister Dibb tells a story about a man whom her father had helped and assisted, and through the story testifies of friendship and loyalty.

item.title: A More Excellent Way
item.description: Elder Wirthlin tells us that without charity, we are missing the most important aspect of Christ—His love.

item.title: All Things Work Together for Good
item.description: Elder Martino tells of a lesson taught by the Apostle Paul to the Romans, and teaches us that our trials allow us to become more like the Savior

item.title: Share Gospel with Radiance
item.description: Elder Russel M. Nelson encourages us to be a bright example to those around us, and willing to share the gospel with warmth when called upon to do so.

item.title: Exceeding Great and Precious Promises
item.description: Elder Spencer J. Condie talks about the specific blessings that come from keeping the commandments of God.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen teaches us to surround ourselves in spiritual things to help us overcome a trial of faith.

item.title: Anointing the Sick
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the authority of the Melchizedek Priesthood.

item.title: The Tongue Is a Fire
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland warns us to be cautious of what we say, and to always use kidness and consideration in our words.

item.title: Light Dispels Darkness
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales tells us how we can repel the darkness of Satan with the light of Christ.

item.title: Potential to Become Like God
item.description: Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin recounts a story when Elder James E. Talmage exemplified Christlike kindness.

item.title: Working out Our Salvation
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that even after all our efforts at obedience and faithfulness, we must still rely on the atonement and grace of Christ.

item.title: Receiving the Lord’s Name
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar tells us that it is through the ordinances of the gospel that we take upon us the name of Christ.

item.title: There Are Two Powers on the Earth
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley warns that a war between good and evil is being waged in this world, but that we should not fear because it is a fight we will win.

item.title: Patience
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf lays out the attributes and characteristic associated with patience.

item.title: Cast Not Away Therefore Your Confidence
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands warns that the most difficult oppostition often comes when we are the most diligent and faithful.

item.title: Testimony of Jesus Is the Spirit of Prophecy
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that our testimony of Jesus Christ and the gospel can only come through personal revelation.

item.title: Serving without Love
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that you can't be a true servant of Christ without love and selflessness.

item.title: Sacrificing for Christ’s Sake
item.description: President Spencer W. Kimball encourages us to sacrifice all that we have for the work of God.

item.title: Philosophies of Man Fall Short
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf says that while the world offers many explanations and answers, only the gospel ofJesus Christ contains the full and simple truth.

item.title: High Priest of Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Hollands encourages those struggling to not lose hope, that the gospel of Jesus Christ offers happiness and help in times of trouble.

item.title: Recognize when Spirit Leaves
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar encourages us to stay out of situations that would cause the spirit to withdraw itself.

item.title: The Great Apostasy
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains the great apostasy.

item.title: Savior Knows Our Infirmities
item.description: Elder Merrill J. Bateman teaches that the atonement was a personal experience where Christ felt our suffering on an individual basis, thus allowing him to know exactly how to help us.

item.title: Jesus Christ Is in the Express Image of His Father
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland explains that Jesus being in the express image of His Father is a witness to both the ancient and modern world of what God the Father is like.

item.title: Spirit of Fear
item.description: President Thomas S Monson encourages us to face with courage the trials and difficulties of the future.

item.title: Qualifications for Bishops
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley lists the qualities and attributes of successful bishops.

item.title: Counsel Concerning Wealth
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales warns us to be frugal and careful with our money.

item.title: Purpose in Earthly Challenges
item.description: Elder Hales explains that, in order for us to become more like Christ, we must overcome the trials and tribulations in our lives.

item.title: Man from Ethiopia
item.description: Elder Holland teaches that for each of us to come unto Christ and follow Him and His commandments is a significant task is all our lives. But we must have sufficient instruction, and as such must seek guidance.

item.title: Revelation Follows Lines of Authority
item.description: Elder Perry explains that there is order to the Lord’s revelations, and so it is that one in a position of authority may receive revelation for those under him. Revelations from God are to come through the First Presidency.

item.title: Requirements for Unity
item.description: President Kimball instructs us to put aside selfish desires, cooperate with one another, and offer up a broken heart and contrite spirit.

item.title: How Apostles Are Called
item.description: President Hinckley states that modern-day Apostles are chosen by revelation from the Spirit, and do not put themselves forward.

item.title: Jerusalem Conference
item.description: Elder Christofferson teaches that the same pattern practiced by the Apostles of old has been restored, and that the First Presidency and Quorum of The Twelve receive revelation for the Church.

item.title: Charity
item.description: (1 Corinthians 13:1-13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks emphasizes the need for charity in order to obtain eternal life.

item.title: Church Callings
item.description: (1 Corinthians 12:19-23) President Gordon B. Hinckley emphasizes that all callings are important to the Lord.

item.title: Partake of Sacrament Worthily
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:23-31) Elder John H. Groberg teaches of the personal way to discern one's worthiness for the sacrament. ("The Beauty and Importance of the Sacrament," Ensign, May 1989, 38.)

item.title: Man And Woman
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:11) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that man and woman are God's design.

item.title: The Devil's Side of the Line
item.description: (1 Corinthians 10:13) President George Albert Smith teaches all to stay close to the Lord to find safety.

item.title: Ability To Bear
item.description: (1 Corinthians 10-13) President Boyd K. Packer urges us to resist the temptations of Satan.

item.title: Master The Flesh
item.description: (1 Corinthians 9:24-25) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the importance of keeping covenants with God.

item.title: Flee Fornication
item.description: (1 Corinthians 6:9-11 and 18-20) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about how we should flee fornication.

item.title: Bodies Are Temples
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3:16-17) President Thomas S. Monson talks about how our bodies are temples of God.

item.title: Fed With Milk
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3:1-15) President Boyd K. Packer talks about how we are rewarded for the work we do.

item.title: Making Choices
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3-6) Keeping a home clean and beautiful serves as an analogy about keeping our lives worthy of the Spirit. Segment 2 - Making choices.

item.title: Room Transformation
item.description: (1 Corinthians 3-6) Keeping a home clean and beautiful serves as an analogy about keeping our lives worthy of the Spirit. Segment 1 - Room transformation.

item.title: Natural Man
item.description: (1 Corinthians 2:9-14) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin says that the natural man will not receive the things of the spirit.

item.title: Serving for the Right Reason
item.description: (Romans 16:18) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about serving for the right reason.

item.title: Love Your Neighbor
item.description: (Romans 14:10-12) Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about loving our neighbors.

item.title: Foreordained
item.description: (Romans 9:9-14) President Harold B. Lee teaches of the blessings of our good decisions in the premortal life.

item.title: Nothing Can Separate
item.description: (Romans 8:38-39) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about how we can never be separated from God's love.

item.title: Newness Of Life
item.description: (Romans 6:1-6) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about walking in the newness of life.

item.title: All Have Sinned
item.description: (Romans 3:10-12; 23-26) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about how everyone has sinned.

item.title: Natural Affection
item.description: (Romans 1:24-27) President Boyd K. Packer warns against Satan's influence in perverting the sacred powers of procreation.

item.title: Faith and Works
item.description: (Romans) An expedition to the North Pole serves as an analogy of how grace, faith, and works and necessary to gain eternal life.

item.title: Receiving Daily Assistance
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 3 - Receiving daily assistance.

item.title: Paralyzed Gymnast
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 2 - Paralyzed gymnast.

item.title: Parable of the Bicycle
item.description: (Romans) Three segments illustrate how the Lord's grace can help us gain salvation, overcome trials, and receive His daily assistance. Segment 1 - Parable of the bicycle.

item.title: Growing Through Life's Trials
item.description: (Acts 28:1-10) Elder Richard G. Scott discusses how to pass through life's trials willingly by trusting in the Lord. ("Finding Joy in Life," Ensign, May 1996, 24-26)

item.title: Prophets Warning
item.description: (Acts 27:9-44) Elder Spencer J. Condie uses a story of a broken bridge to tell of his gratitude for modern prophets who warn us of danger.

item.title: Valiant In Testimony
item.description: (Acts 24:10-21) Elder Dallin H. Oaks defines what it means to be valiant in the testimony of Jesus Christ. ("Witnesses of Christ," Ensign, Nov. 1990, 29.)

item.title: Others Beliefs
item.description: (Acts 21:16-26) Elder M. Russell Ballard reminds us to respect and love those who have different beliefs and values.

item.title: Paul: A Chosen Vessel
item.description: (Acts 21-28) This presentation depicts how the Lord molded and prepared Paul for his call to the ministry.

item.title: Spread Doubt
item.description: (Acts 20:29-30) President Gordon B. Hinckley invites all who have drifted from the Church to return.

item.title: Proclaim The Gospel
item.description: (Acts 16:9-15) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about how we are here to proclaim the gospel.

item.title: Culture Of Christ
item.description: (Acts 15:1-29) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about following the culture of Christ.

item.title: Respector of Persons
item.description: (Acts 10:34) Elder James M. Paramore shares a story of a Mormon American soldier administering to a wounded German soldier in World War II.

item.title: Long-Promised Day
item.description: (Acts 10) This presentation is a modern-day example of the Lord directing the Church through revelation to His prophet.

item.title: Godhead
item.description: (Acts 7:55-56) Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies of the three separate beings of the Godhead.

item.title: Ananias And Sapphira
item.description: (Acts 5:1-11) Neal A. Maxwell speaks about lying.

item.title: The Lame Man
item.description: (Acts 3:2-8) President Gordon B. Hinckley counsels all to reach out to those who need help.

item.title: A New Apostle
item.description: (Acts 1:23-26) President Gordon B. Hinckley explains the process of choosing a new Apostle of the Lord.

item.title: Armour Of Light
item.description: (Romans 13:11-14) Elder Robert D. Hales talkes about putting on the Armour of Light and casting off the works of darkness.

item.title: Godly Sorrow Leads to Repentance
item.description: A young woman learns the difference between worldly sorrow and godly sorrow. 2 Corinthians 7

item.title: Lesson 1: The Message of the New Testament
item.description: Elder Thomas S. Monson speaks of the message of hope and joy in the New Testament.

item.title: Lesson 5: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus teaches a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Anointed One
item.description: Jesus declares He is the promised Messiah to the people in the synagogue.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Purse and Scrip
item.description: A purse holds money, and a scrip is a travel bag.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Worship in the Synagogue
item.description: Congregation members in the synagogue participate in gospel instructions. Paul uses this to teach the gospel.

item.title: Lesson 8: New Testament Customs—Schoolmaster
item.description: The Law of Moses prepared people for the Savior's higher law.

item.title: Lesson 9: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 10: Come Unto Me
item.description: A woman anoints Jesus's feet with oil. Jesus teaches the parable of the two debtors.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—The Synagogue
item.description: Those that were kicked out of the synagogue were considered excommunicated.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—Shepherd and Sheepfold
item.description: The sheep trust and follow only the voice of the shepherd.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Leprosy
item.description: Leprosy was the most feared disease in the Holy Land.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Time
item.description: In the ancient Middle East, time was divided differently than today's current measurements.

item.title: Lesson 20: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 22: New Testament Customs—Marriage
item.description: Traditionally, the bridegroom journeys through town to meet his bride.

item.title: Lesson 23: New Testament Customs—Feasting
item.description: Feasting was done reclining on couches.

item.title: Lesson 25: New Testament Customs—Olive Press
item.description: Gethsemane means "oil press."

item.title: Lesson 31: The Second Coming
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer and Elder Neal A. Maxwell give counsel and caution regarding the Second Coming.

item.title: Lesson 38: Paul—A Chosen Vessel
item.description: This segment relates the life and mission of Paul.

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 1 - Archaeologists' Discovery
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 1 - Archaeologists' discovery. Revelation

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 2 - Structure and Symbols
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 2 - Structure and symbols. Revelation

item.title: Helps for Understanding the Book of Revelation Segment 3 - Main Theme
item.description: An archaeologist and two assistants discover symbols from the book of Revelation on the walls of an ancient room. Segment 3 - Main theme. Revelation

category.title: Bible Videos - The Life of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 100

item.title: Reconciled to God
item.description: The gospel reconciles man to God. 2 Corinthians 5:17-21

item.title: The Armour of God
item.description: Saints should put on the whole armor of God. Ephesians 6:10-18

item.title: Repentance
item.description: Godly sorrow for sin leads to repentance. 2 Corinthians 7:8-10

item.title: Resurrection of the Dead
item.description: Paul teaches of the Resurrection of the Dead. 1 Corinthians 15: 20-26

item.title: The Apostasy and Restoration
item.description: Paul forewarns of the apostasy that will precede the Second Coming of the Lord. 2 Thessalonians 2:1-3

item.title: Ye are the Temple of God
item.description: Paul teaches the Saints they are the temple of God. 1 Corinthians 3:14-17

item.title: Calming the Tempest
item.description: The disciples' faith is tested before Jesus calms the stormy sea. Mark 4:37-40

item.title: Parable of the Sower
item.description: Jesus explains why he teaches with parables and gives the parable of the sower to a multitude gathered on the seashore. Matthew 13:1-23

item.title: Laborers in the Vineyard
item.description: Jesus gives the parable of the laborers in the Vineyard. Matthew 19-20; Mark 10; Luke 18

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat & Tares, Mustard Seed, and Leaven
item.description: Jesus uses parables to teach a crowd of people about the kingdom of heaven. Matthew 13

item.title: Lazarus is Raised from the Dead
item.description: Jesus testifies that He is the resurrection and the life. He raises Lazarus from the dead that His disciples may believe. John 11:1-44

item.title: Feed My Sheep
item.description: Jesus shows Himself to His disciples and implores Peter to feed His sheep. John 21:1-22

item.title: Wherefore Didst Thou Doubt?
item.description: Jesus walks on water, and bids Peter to come unto Him. Matthew 14:25-33

item.title: The Feeding of the 5,000
item.description: Jesus provides a meal for 5,000 people with only five loaves of bread and two fishes. Matthew 14:13-21

item.title: Christ's Authority is Questioned
item.description: Christ's authority is questioned by the chief priests and elders. He relates the parable of the two sons to them. Matthew 21:23-32

item.title: Widow Of Nain
item.description: Jesus raises the son of the widow of Nain from death. Luke 7:11-16

item.title: I Have Kept the Faith
item.description: Paul endures to the end and gives a solemn charge to preach the gospel in a day of apostasy. 2 Timothy 4:1-8

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Charity, the pure love of Christ, exceeds almost all else. 1 Corinthians 13

item.title: Be of Good Cheer
item.description: Paul is comforted and told by the Lord that he must bear witness of Him in Rome. Acts 23:11

item.title: Unity of the Faith
item.description: Paul writes of one Lord, one faith, one baptism and one Father. Christ appointed apostles, prophets, and teachers to help unify and perfect the saints. Ephesians 4:1-15

item.title: Ye Are No More Strangers
item.description: Paul teaches that the Atonement of Jesus Christ is available for all of God's children. Ephesians 2:10-22

item.title: We Are the Offspring of God
item.description: Paul preaches to Athenians on Mars Hill and identifies their "unknown god" as the Father of us all. He testifies that we all are children of God. Acts 17

item.title: The Jerusalem Conference
item.description: Peter and James speak to the Saints in Jerusalem to convince them that the Gentile converts are not subject to the requirements of the Law of Moses. Acts 15

item.title: The Road to Damascus
item.description: Saul takes his journey to Damascus. While on the road, Jesus appears to Saul. He is blinded by the event. Ananias restores Saul’s sight. Saul is baptized. Acts 9

item.title: Blessed Are They That Have Not Seen, and Yet Have Believed
item.description: Thomas, one of the twelve, doubts the appearance of the risen Lord. Christ appears, and tells him, “Blessed are those who have not seen, and yet have believed.” John 20:24-29

item.title: The Risen Lord Appears to the Apostles
item.description: The resurrected Christ appears to the apostles and tells them “Peace be unto you.” They touch His hands and feet and He eats with them. He tells them He will send them as His father sent Him. Luke 24:36-41, 44-49; John 20:21

item.title: Christ Appears on the Road to Emmaus
item.description: The resurrected Christ walks with two men on the road to Emmaus. He blesses and breaks bread with them, and then vanishes from sight. Their hearts burned within them. Luke 24:13-33

item.title: My Kingdom Is Not of This World
item.description: Jesus is persecuted, mocked and crucified. His followers mourn, and find the tomb empty on the third day. The Son of God breaks the bands of death and ascends to His Father in Heaven. -Easter Part 2

item.title: To This End Was I Born
item.description: Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son of God, and King of the Jews, was born to offer Himself as a sacrifice to atone for the sins of mankind. -Easter Part 1

item.title: A House Divided
item.description: The Son of God declares that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven, and that a house divided against itself shall fall. Luke 11:14-26; Matthew 12:31-42

item.title: Christ and the Rich Young Ruler
item.description: Jesus Christ, the Son of God, teaches a rich man how to gain eternal life. Matthew 19:16-26

item.title: The Naming of John the Baptist
item.description: John the Baptist is born. Zacharias prophesies of John’s mission to prepare the way for the Son of God. Luke 1:57-80

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His father's business, teaching in the temple. Luke 2:40-52

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the ten virgins. Matthew 25:1-13

item.title: The Parable of the Talents
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the talents. Matthew 25:14-30

item.title: Ye Have Done it Unto Me
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the sheep and the goats. Matthew 25:31-46

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Mary conceives by the power of the Holy Ghost – Heavenly messengers herald the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem. Luke 1:26-38; 2:1-19; Matthew 1:20-21

item.title: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
item.description: On the Sabbath day, Jesus heals a man born blind. John 9:1-41

item.title: Jesus Teaches that We Must Become as Little Children
item.description: Those who humble themselves as little children are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven. Matthew 18:1-11; Mark 9:38-42

item.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
item.description: Jesus invites little children to come unto Him, and teaches how to gain eternal life. Luke 18:15-17

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Lost Sheep
item.description: Jesus teaches there shall be joy in heaven over one repentant sinner. Luke 15:2-7

item.title: Jesus Heals a Lame Man on the Sabbath
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle by healing an invalid on the Sabbath day. John 5:2-12

item.title: Seek Ye the Kingdom of God
item.description: Jesus teaches not to lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, but rather to lay up treasures in heaven. Luke 12:13-34

item.title: Follow Me, and I Will Make You Fishers of Men
item.description: Jesus calls Peter, Andrew, James and John to follow Him. Matthew 4:18-22

item.title: The Good Shepherd and Other Sheep I Have
item.description: Jesus is the Good Shepherd. He declares that His Father commanded Him to lay down His life, and take it up again. John 10:1-18

item.title: Jesus Acclaims John the Baptist / Come Unto Me
item.description: Jesus acclaims John the Baptist; rebukes unbelievers; and declares His burden is light. Matthew 11:1-30

item.title: Peter's Revelation to Take the Gospel to the Gentiles
item.description: Peter follows the commandment of the Lord to take the gospel to the Gentiles. Acts 10:1-48; 11:1-18

item.title: Forgive 70 Times 7
item.description: Jesus explains how we are to treat our offending brethren. Matt 18:21-35

item.title: The Prodigal Son
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the prodigal son. Luke 15:11-32

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The kingdom of heaven consists of the just separated out from the wicked. Matt 13:44-51

item.title: Jesus Declares the Parable of the Wheat and the Tares
item.description: Jesus explains the meaning of the parable of the wheat and tares. Matthew 13:36-43

item.title: The Greatest Commandment
item.description: Jesus declares the first and great commandment is to love God with all your heart. Mark 12:28-34

item.title: I am the Bread of Life
item.description: Jesus teaches He is the bread of life. Peter testifies that Jesus is the anointed Son of God. John 6:25-71

item.title: Whosoever Will Lose His Life for My Sake Shall Find It
item.description: Jesus foretells of His death and resurrection. After He comes in the glory of His Father, every man shall be rewarded according to their works. Matt 16:21–28

item.title: Thou Art the Christ
item.description: Peter testifies that Jesus is the Son of God. Jesus declares that He will give the keys of the kingdom to Peter. Matt 16:13–19

item.title: Render unto Caesar and unto God
item.description: Conspiring men seek to entangle Jesus in His words. Instead, the Savior wittingly teaches them that it is possible to respect civil authority and honor God. Mark 12:13-17

item.title: Peter and John Continue Preaching the Gospel
item.description: Peter and John continue preaching and healing in the name of Jesus Christ, despite the attempts of the authorities to stop them. Acts 5:12-42

item.title: Peter and John Are Judged
item.description: Peter and John preach in the name of Jesus Christ, and are brought before the leaders of the Jews for questioning. Acts 4:5-21

item.title: Peter Preaches and is Arrested
item.description: Peter and John are arrested for preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ in Jerusalem. Acts 3:12-26, 4:1-3

item.title: Peter and John Heal a Man Crippled Since Birth
item.description: With authority from Jesus Christ, Peter and John heal a man crippled since birth. Acts 3:1-8

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives! Luke 2:1-20

item.title: For God So Loved the World
item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection. John 3:16

item.title: Jesus Declares, "I Am the Light of the World, the Truth Shall Make You Free"
item.description: Jesus declares that He is the light of the world, and the Son of God. Whosoever will embrace His gospel and follow Him can be freed from sin. John 8:12-58

item.title: Jesus Cleanses the Temple
item.description: Jesus clears worldly merchandise from the temple courts in order to keep the temple a holy place. John 2:13-17

item.title: Jesus Forgives Sins and Heals a Man Stricken with Palsy
item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities. Mark 2:1-12

item.title: Jesus Raises the Daughter of Jairus
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by raising a young girl from the dead. Mark 5:22-24, 35-43

item.title: Go and Sin No More
item.description: Jesus teaches about compassion when confronted with a woman accused of adultery. John 8:2-11

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: Treasures in Heaven
item.description: In His Sermon on the Mount, Jesus teaches His disciples what it means to be a compassionate follower of His Gospel. Matthew 6:19-21; 7:1-27

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Lord's Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples the correct manner of prayer and offers the Lord's prayer. Matthew 6:1-13

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Higher Law
item.description: Jesus teaches His followers essential Christian traits, such as kindness, forgiveness, and love. Matthew 5:17-48

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus describes the characteristics of true Christians. Matthew 5:3-16

item.title: Jesus Heals a Woman of Faith
item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing. Mark 5:22-43

item.title: Jesus Calls Twelve Apostles to Preach and Bless Others
item.description: Jesus instructs and empowers His original Twelve Apostles. Matthew 10:1-5

item.title: Jesus Declares He Is the Messiah
item.description: Jesus announces that He is the Messiah prophesied by Isaiah, but is rejected by His neighbors in Nazareth. Luke 4:15-30

item.title: Jesus Teaches of Being Born Again
item.description: In the darkness of night, Jesus teaches Nicodemus about the necessity of every person being born again. John 3:1-36

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples. Luke 1:26-35

item.title: He is Risen
item.description: Ponder what the Savior means to all humanity—and to you personally. And then share the good news. John 20:11-17

item.title: The Baptism of Jesus
item.description: Jesus seeks out John the Baptist and is baptized in order to fulfill all righteousness. Matthew 3:13-17

item.title: Jesus Turns Water into Wine
item.description: Jesus performs a miraculous act of service in one of the first recorded events of His ministry. John 2:1-12

item.title: Jesus Heals a Possessed Man
item.description: Jesus demonstrates His divine power by healing a possessed man. Luke 4:33-37

item.title: Jesus Is Resurrected
item.description: Peter and John find the empty tomb. Jesus, now resurrected, appears to Mary. John 20:3-18

item.title: Jesus Is Laid in a Tomb
item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb. Matthew 27:57-60

item.title: Jesus Is Scourged and Crucified
item.description: A band of soldiers strips Jesus of His clothes, scourges Him, and mocks Him. He then carries His cross to Golgotha and is crucified by Roman soldiers. Matthew 27:26-50

item.title: Jesus Is Condemned Before Pilate
item.description: Jesus is arraigned and questioned before Pilate, who finds no fault in Him. Yielding to the multitude, Pilate allows Barabbas to be released and Jesus to be crucified. Matthew 27:1-2, 11-25

item.title: The Lord's Triumphal Entry into Jerusalem
item.description: Jesus rides in triumph into Jerusalem. The multitudes greet Him with shouts of Hosanna to the Son of David. Matthew 21:1-11

item.title: Jesus Is Tried by Caiaphas, Peter Denies Knowing Him
item.description: Jesus is tried before Caiaphas and the chief priests. Peter denies knowing Him and weeps bitterly. Matthew 26:57-75

item.title: The Savior Suffers in Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus, Peter, James, and John retire to the Garden of Gethsemane. Jesus submits to the Father's will and begins to suffer for the sins and afflictions of mankind. He is then betrayed and arrested. Matthew 26:36-57

item.title: Jesus Warns Peter and Offers the Intercessory Prayer
item.description: Jesus admonishes Peter to remain faithful and strengthen his brethren. Peter professes his devotion to Jesus. Jesus foretells Peter's denial and then gives the Intercessory Prayer. Luke 22:31-34

item.title: The Last Supper
item.description: Meeting in an upper room with His disciples, Jesus washes their feet, institutes the sacrament, and commands them to love one another. John 13:1-35

item.title: Jesus Teaches a Samaritan Woman
item.description: While traveling through Samaria, the Savior teaches a woman at Jacob's Well that He is the "living water." John 4:5-29

item.title: Parable of the Good Samaritan
item.description: A depiction of the Savior's parable of the good Samaritan, in which a man is robbed and beaten by thieves, and a Samaritan shows mercy on him. Luke 10:25-37

item.title: Jesus Teaches about the Widow's Mites
item.description: A poor widow contributes her all into the temple treasury. Jesus teaches that her contribution is greater than that of the rich who gave of their abundance. Mark 12:41-44

item.title: Bible Videos - Introduction
item.description: The Life of Jesus Christ Bible Videos can help you experience Christ's ministry as never before. See how in this introductory video.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child. Matthew 2:1-2, 11-15

item.title: The Christ Child Is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day. Luke 2:22-38

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus. Luke 2:8-18

item.title: Mary and Joseph Travel to Bethlehem
item.description: Traveling to their ancestral city of Bethlehem, Mary and Joseph are unable to find a room in an inn. Instead, they find shelter in a place where animals are kept. Luke 2:4-7

item.title: Mary and Elisabeth Rejoice Together
item.description: Mary visits her relative Elisabeth, who in her old age will also soon give birth to a miraculous child. The women rejoice together. Luke 1:39-55

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus. Luke 1:26-38

item.title: A Gift to the World
item.description: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. John 3:16

item.title: Testing Revelation
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that every person can go to the source of revelation, through prayer, to verify the authenticity of the message taught by modern prophets.

item.title: Nothing Accidental or Spontaneous
item.description: A video explaining that God's creations are made with a purpose.

item.title: Skiing Expedition
item.description: (Number 12) A young man learns the importance of trusting an experienced guide as they ski down a mountain.

item.title: Separating Ourselves from the World
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) Elder Hales teaches church members to be in the world but not of the world.

item.title: Cling to Gods Values
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) President Hinckley encourages saints to cling to God's values.

item.title: Windows of Personal Revelation
item.description: (Leviticus 11:1-45) Elder Wirthlin teaches that if we keep our bodies pure and obey the Word of Wisdom the windows of revelation will be open unto us.

item.title: Sacrifice and Sacrament
item.description: (Leviticus 1-7) A man goes back in time to teach his younger self about the purposes of sacrifice and sacrament. By understanding the symbolism of animal sacrifice in the Old Testament, we come to realize its similarity to the sacrament—to remember the Savior and to commit ourselves to him.

item.title: Real, Personal Sacrifice
item.description: (Exodus 29:15-18) Elder Maxwell teaches the importance of sacrifice.

item.title: How a Priesthood Bearer Should Dress
item.description: (Exodus 28:2-4) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives a suggestion on how priesthood bearers should dress.

item.title: The Power and Authority of God
item.description: (Exodus 28:1) President Faust explains the power of the priesthood and encourages priesthood holders to live worthily of its power.

item.title: The Tabernacle
item.description: (Exodus 25-30) A video explaining the Tabernacle and its importance.

item.title: Peculiar People
item.description: (Exodus 19:3-8) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains the meaning of peculiar people.

item.title: Sin of Murmuring
item.description: (Exodus 15:22-27) Elder Maxwell explains that murmuring is a sin of the natural man.

item.title: Sacrament of the Lords Supper
item.description: (Exodus 12:1-28) Elder L. Tom Perry explains the importance of the Lord's supper.

item.title: The Passover
item.description: (Exodus 12) A short video explaining the meaning of the Passover and it's significance.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Exodus 3:1-10) President Boyd K. Packer teaches that reverence invites the spirit of revelation.

item.title: A Seer Will I Raise Up
item.description: (JST, Genesis 50) Joseph Smith is prepared to bring to pass the restoration of the Gospel.

item.title: Declaration of Lineage in Patriarchal Blessings
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Faust explains the declaration of lineage and why it is in the Patriarchal blessing.

item.title: A Sacred Guideline
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Faust explains how the Patriarchal blessings is a sacred guideline.

item.title: Our Own Liahona
item.description: (Genesis 49) President Monson explains how Patriarchal blessings can be our own Liahona.

item.title: Priesthood Blessings
item.description: (Genesis 48:14-20) Elder Oaks teaches the significance of a priesthood blessing.

item.title: Sin Results in Suffering
item.description: Elder Ballard speaks on the suffering that sin can bring to our lives (Genesis 42:3-24).

item.title: Temporal Preparation
item.description: (Genesis 40) President Hinckley encourages church members to be prepared for future calamities.

item.title: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Benson teaches church members to choose God first.

item.title: Shun Immorality
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Hinckley encourages church members to avoid the immorality we have in the world today.

item.title: For God Did Send Me
item.description: (Genesis 37-41) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches to hold the God's standards high and be an example to the world.

item.title: Many Esaus
item.description: (Genesis 25:24-34) Elder Oaks teaches to seek spiritual things before worldly things.

item.title: Thousands of Millions
item.description: (Genesis 24:1-4,60) A video teaching that the choices we make in this life can affect the generations to come.

item.title: Akedah (The Binding)
item.description: (Genesis 22:1-18) A video of Abraham offering his son Isaac as a sacrifice unto the Lord.

item.title: Gliding Naively through Life
item.description: (Genesis 22:1-14) Elder Maxwell teaches that we need to experience challenges in our lives.

item.title: Covenants and Ordinances
item.description: (Genesis 17:1-9) Elder Nelson teaches about the importance of covenants.

item.title: Abraham
item.description: (Genesis 17) The Lord appears to Abraham and covenants with him.

item.title: Things of the World
item.description: (Genesis 13:1-13) Elder Scott teaches to eliminate distractions from our lives.

item.title: The Abrahamic Covenant
item.description: (Genesis 12:1-3; Abraham 2:9-11) One family shows love and service to another less fortunate family.

item.title: Deliverance of Abraham
item.description: (Abraham 1:1-20) The Lord hears the prayer of Abraham and delivers him from his enemies.

item.title: Generous Fast Offerings
item.description: (Abraham 1:1-20) Elder Wirthlin encourages church members to give generous fast offerings.

item.title: Put God First
item.description: (Moses 7:18) President Benson teaches church members to put God first in their lives.

item.title: First Principles and Ordinances
item.description: (Moses 6:58-62) A video describes the importance of the atonement in our lives due to the fall of Adam and Eve.

item.title: Books of Remembrance
item.description: (Moses 6:5) President Kimball speaks on the importance of journals.

item.title: Are We Our Brother's Keeper?
item.description: (Moses 5:32-34) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains why we must be our brother's keeper.

item.title: Salvation through Christ
item.description: (Moses 4:14-25) President Benson teaches that salvation is only through Christ.

item.title: Evidence of Creation
item.description: (Moses 2:26-31) Elder Ballard teaches that there is evidence of the creation all around us.

item.title: Christ the Creator
item.description: (Moses 2:1) Elder Maxwell testifies that Christ is the creator of our world and our savior.

item.title: The Creation
item.description: (Genesis 1; Moses 2) Elder Nelson explains the creation and its importance.

item.title: Gods Work and Glory
item.description: (Moses 1:39) A video explains the importance of symbols and why they are used in the scriptures.

item.title: I've Got to Find Out Who I Am
item.description: (Moses 1:10-22) A song about finding out who we are.

item.title: A Child of God
item.description: (Moses 1:1-22) Elder Oaks teaches that we are all children of God.

item.title: I Am a Son of God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Narrates a depiction of the story of Moses

item.title: God Has Held You in Reserve
item.description: (Abraham 3:22-28) Elder Marvin J. Ashton teaches about the last generation of righteous church members.

item.title: Children of Israel
item.description: Primary children talk about their faith and the gospel.

item.title: Many Plain and Precious Things
item.description: A video explaining the importance of the Joseph Smith translation of the bible.

item.title: Time Capsule
item.description: Seminary students reflect their opinions on the Old Testament and show their excitement to study it.

item.title: The Importance of the Old Testament
item.description: President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: The Atonement
item.description: (Moses 5:5-9) A video explaining the atonement and our potential.

item.title: Josiah and the Book of the Law
item.description: (2 Kings 22-23) King Josiah motivates his kingdom to repent from their wicked ways by reading from the Book of the Law.

item.title: For Such a Time as This
item.description: (Esther 1-4) Showing her faith, Esther demonstrates courage by standing up for the Jews.

item.title: To Look Upon
item.description: (2 Samuel 11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks relates the story of King David to illustrate the dangers of pornography. See OvercomingPornography.org.

item.title: Worldly Pleasures
item.description: (Ecclesiastes 1-2) Elder Perry encourages church members to seek of the things of the spirit and not those of the world.

item.title: Parachutes
item.description: (Proverbs 3:5-6) A video describing the importance of following instructions.

item.title: I Am Clean
item.description: (Psalms 24:3-4) President Hinckley relates a dream that was had by President Joseph F. Smith.

item.title: Singing Hymns
item.description: (Psalms) Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches the importance of singing Hymns.

item.title: Faith and Trials
item.description: (Job 42:10-17) Elder Hales teaches to show faith during trials.

item.title: Support through Trials
item.description: (Job 1-23) Elder Scott teaches that we will grow stronger and the Lord will bless us as we pass through trials.

item.title: When All Is Said and Done
item.description: (Esther 1-6) A song about the life of Esther.

item.title: Worldwide Access to Temples
item.description: (Ezra 1-6) President Hinckley expresses his desire that a temple be built in close distance to all latter-day saints.

item.title: Temples Are Built by Faith and Sacrifice
item.description: (2 Chronicles 1-7) President Monson teaches that temples are built by the sacrifices of members of the church.

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (586 BC)
item.description: (2 Kings 24-25) A news team gives report of the destruction of Jerusalem.

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (600 BC)
item.description: (2 Kings 24-25) A news team gives updates on life in 600 BC.

item.title: One Voice
item.description: (2 Kings 22-23) A song about the strength of one voice for righteousness.

item.title: Pride
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-19) Elder Ballard tells the story of Naaman and relates it to pride.

item.title: Obedience
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-14) President Benson teaches obedience and that we should love the Lord.

item.title: Naaman and Elisha
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-14) Naaman is healed by following the prophets counsel.

item.title: Spirit Whispers
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Eyring teaches that the Spirit will bear testimony if we listen.

item.title: Still, Small Voice
item.description: (1 Kings 19:11-13) President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: Elijah and the Widow of Zarephath
item.description: (1 Kings 17) During a time of famine, the prophet Elijah rewards the faith of Zarephath with food.

item.title: Temple Ordinances Are Crucial
item.description: (1 Kings 6) President Hunter explains the importance of temple attendance.

item.title: Blessings of Repentance
item.description: (2 Samuel 13-22) Elder Scott teaches the wonderful blessing of repentance.

item.title: True Friend
item.description: (1 Samuel 18-23) President Eyring explains the importance of having a true friend.

item.title: The Lord Will Deliver Me
item.description: (1 Samuel 17) Elder Oaks tells the story of David and Goliath.

item.title: Measure of Our Hearts
item.description: (1 Samuel 16:1-13) Elder Marvin J. Ashton explains how the Lord measures our hearts.

item.title: Choose to Be Humble
item.description: (1 Samuel 15:10-35) President Hinckley encourages church member to choose to be humble.

item.title: Whom the Lord Calls
item.description: (1 Samuel 10) President Monson teaches "whom the Lord calls, the Lord qualifies."

item.title: Samuel and Eli
item.description: (1 Samuel 3:1-10) Samuel hears the voice of Lord.

item.title: For This Child I Prayed
item.description: (1 Samuel 1:1-10) A young woman ponders the decision of having a family and its importance.

item.title: Hannah's Faith
item.description: (1 Samuel 1) Hannah prays to the Lord to bless her with a son.

item.title: God Helps Ordinary People
item.description: (Judges 6-7) President Faust relates the story of Gideon from the Bible, explaining that the Lord can do remarkable things through a person with ordinary faith.

item.title: Parents Choices Affect Children
item.description: (Judges 2) Elder Maxwell teaches that choices made by parents have large effects on their children.

item.title: Full Commitment
item.description: (Joshua 24:15) President Hunter speaks on Joshua's commitment to following the commandments of the Lord.

item.title: Walk His Way
item.description: (Joshua 24:14-27) A song about choosing to walk in the ways of the Lord.

item.title: No Other Gods before Me
item.description: (Joshua 23-24) A young man relates the dangers of carbon monoxide to that of Idolatry.

item.title: The Incomparable Atonement
item.description: (Isaiah 53) President Faust explains the importance of the Atonement and encourages church members to learn more about it.

item.title: Daniel in the Lions' Den
item.description: (Daniel 6) The Lord delivers Daniel from the lion's den.

item.title: The Sealing Power
item.description: (Malachi 4:5-6) A woman bears testimony of the sealing powers of the priesthood.

item.title: Paying Tithing
item.description: (Malachi 3:8-12) Elder Oaks explains the importance of paying tithing.

item.title: God Reveals His Secrets
item.description: (Amos 3:7) A video depicting how God has spoken to his prophets.

item.title: No Light without Prophets
item.description: (Amos 3:3-8) Elder Mark E. Peterson explains the importance of prophets.

item.title: The Gardener
item.description: (Joel 2) A gardener anxiously awaits the return of the housemaster.

item.title: Piano Recital
item.description: (Joel 2) A young man learns the importance of practice and to avoid procrastination.

item.title: Move This Work Forward
item.description: (Daniel 2:31-45) President Hinckley encourages church members to lead by example and move the work of the Lord forward.

item.title: Revelation Is among Us
item.description: (Daniel 2) President Hinckley declares that God still speaks to his holy prophets.

item.title: Ezekiels Prophecy Fulfilled
item.description: (Ezekiel 37:15-17) President Packer explains Ezekiel's prophecy and how it has been fulfilled.

item.title: Watchman on the Tower
item.description: (Ezekiel 33:1-7) The Lord calls prophets to be the "watchmen" on the tower.

item.title: Lord Works from Inside Out
item.description: President Benson teaches that the Lord works from the inside out (Ezekiel 18:21-24).

item.title: Stand a Little Taller
item.description: President Hinckley challenges church members to stand a little taller (Ezekiel 5-15).

item.title: We Should Honor and Keep Covenants
item.description: President Faust teaches the importance of keeping covenants (Jeremiah 31:31-34).

item.title: Blessings of Following Prophets
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry teaches obedience to the prophet yields blessings (Jeremiah 27-28).

item.title: Following the Prophet
item.description: (Jeremiah 20-21) President Eyring speaks on the importance of listening to the prophet.

item.title: Sisters Are Not Obligated to Serve Missions
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) President Hinckley declares that sisters are not obligated to serve missions.

item.title: Need for Greatest Generation of Missionaries
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Elder Ballard speaks on the standard of missionary service, and encourages young men to live worthily to serve missions.

item.title: Fishers and Hunters
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Missionary work is a vital part in the growth of the church.

item.title: Gathering of Israel
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) A video depicting the growth of missionary work in the church.

item.title: Arabian Horse
item.description: (Jeremiah 11:4) A video shows how an Arabian horse is trained to be totally obedient.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand
item.description: (Jeremiah 1:4-10) President Monson declares "When we are on the Lord's errand we are entitled to the Lord's help."

item.title: Wherefore Have We Fasted
item.description: (Isaiah 58) A young man recounts a lesson learned from his youth.

item.title: Come unto Christ
item.description: (Isaiah 55:1-7) Elder Holland gives the invitation to come unto Christ.

item.title: Bring Back Those Who Are Lost
item.description: (Isaiah 54:1-3) President Hinckley encourages church members to bring back those who are lost.

item.title: Isaiah Prophesied of Christ
item.description: (Isaiah 53) A video telling of Isaiah's writings of the Savior.

item.title: A Marvelous Work and a Wonder
item.description: (Isaiah 29:4-14) The story of Joseph Smith and his translation of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Perilous Times
item.description: (Isaiah 24) President Hinckley teaches that despite the perilous times that we live in we can all have peace in our lives by living the gospel.

item.title: Following Prophetic Counsel
item.description: (Isaiah 1-12) Elder Ballard declares there is safety in following the prophets counsel.
